page.title: 04BARLEY FARM
page.content: Barley Farm consists of an old black and white farmhouse and 76 acres of land.It is owned by Mr&Mrs.G.Brooke, who bought it 15 years ago.They also own about 16 acres of land at HalfKey, which is about 5 miles away from Barley Farm. Mr.Brooke keeps three types of cattle Hereford cross,Limousin and Charolais. He goes to market most days as he buys and sells cattle for local farmers as well as for himself.He also keeps sheep for breeding, selling the fat lambs and pigs for pork. He doesn't grow cereals but grows grass for silage, hay and pasture. He grubbed out his orchards as the profit from small scale fruit growing was very low.In our survey we found a number of farms where this had been done.
